description_txt: stated on October 21, 2012 in an answer for the League of Women Voters, Austiin Area, Voters Guide.:
quote_txt: "Texas’ population is projected to double in the next 50 years or so, but our basic amount of water will remain about where it is now."

description_txt: stated on November 4, 2012 in a TV interview:
quote_txt: Says Jeb Bush "extended early voting" after seeing "long lines."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2012 in in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Mitt Romney made over a hundred million dollars by shutting down (a Marion, Ind. paper) plant."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2012 in an interview with The Plain Dealer:
quote_txt: "We have more hospitals that are children’s hospitals than any other state in the union." 

description_txt: stated on October 16, 2012 in an article:
quote_txt: "The higher the education level, the more likely they are to vote Democratic."

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2012 in in a post on Facebook.:
quote_txt: Says that "Tennessee law requires that schools receive half of proceeds -- $31 million per year" -- from a half-cent increase in the Shelby County sales tax.

description_txt: stated on October 18, 2012 in a campaign mailer to New Hampshire residents :
quote_txt: Says Ovide Lamontagne wants to eliminate kindergarten.

description_txt: stated on October 24, 2012 in an ad titled “Hiding”:
quote_txt: Gubernatorial candidate Maggie Hassan supported 33 tax and fee increases as Senate Majority Leader.

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2012 in a TV commercial:
quote_txt: "Sheldon Whitehouse [got] a secret closed-door briefing, warning of the [2008 economic] crash."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • November 3, 2012

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2012 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Senate candidate Tommy Thompson "says he’ll do away with Medicare."

description_txt: stated on October 15, 2012 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: Says U.S. Senate candidate Tammy Baldwin "proposed a $3.9 trillion tax increase -- a tax increase so extreme" that "even Nancy Pelosi voted against it."

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2012 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney "was director of a company that stole millions from Medicare."

description_txt: stated on November 2, 2012 in a tweet:
quote_txt: Says during George W. Bush’s administration "we were losing millions of jobs per month," while under Barack Obama we have "three years of gaining hundreds of thousands of jobs per month."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2012 in a debate in Davie, Fla.:
quote_txt: Says Connie Mack "wrote a letter to the Department of Transportation in order to get $29 million in stimulus for his congressional district."

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2012 in a Spanish-language TV commercial:
quote_txt: "Obama's Environmental Protection Agency sent emails for Hispanic Heritage Month with a photo of Che Guevara."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2012 in a campaign ad:
quote_txt: "After Patrick Murphy’s charges were dropped, Murphy’s father gave the prosecutor a huge campaign donation."

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2012 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: Says Mitt Romney wants to "get rid of Planned Parenthood."

description_txt: stated on October 26, 2012 in a mailer to voters:
quote_txt: Says "Romney supported a law that could have made most common forms of birth control illegal."

description_txt: stated on October 10, 2012 in a debate:
quote_txt: Says Jim Renacci has "consistently voted" for loopholes that "encourage outsourcing of our jobs."

description_txt: stated on October 23, 2012 in a debate:
quote_txt: "The Ryan budget gets rid of Medicare in 10 years and turns it into a voucher program."
footer: By C. Eugene Emery Jr. • November 2, 2012

description_txt: stated on October 26, 2012 in a fundraising email:
quote_txt: "Bill Nelson actually voted in favor of higher taxes 272 times."

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2012 in a TV ad:
quote_txt: "Tommy Thompson made millions from corporations who outsource American jobs and now he's trying to lavish huge tax breaks on them."

description_txt: stated on October 17, 2012 in a debate:
quote_txt: Says Connie Mack was "the only member of the Florida delegation that voted against a bill to help NASA."

description_txt: stated on October 26, 2012 in debate comments:
quote_txt: On support for U.S. Rep. Paul Ryan’s Medicare reform plan

description_txt: stated on October 30, 2012 in a campaign mailer.:

description_txt: stated on October 22, 2012 in a League of Women Voters guide for Texas and Austin voters:
quote_txt: Says U.S. corporate tax rate is "highest in the world at 35 percent."

description_txt: stated on October 25, 2012 in an interview:
quote_txt: On a single-payer healthcare system

description_txt: stated on October 31, 2012 in a radio ad:
quote_txt: Says that Sherrod Brown is an "Obama rubber stamp" for "supporting the job-killing cap and trade plan."
